title: [BUG] Sktime installation with numpy 1.22
body:
**Describe the bug**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->
Numba only supports up to numpy 1.21
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4674372/169277932-888b0ba3-242f-4dd9-bc53-233cd1f918bd.png)

**To Reproduce**
<!--
Add a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example (for more details, see e.g. https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve

If the code is too long, feel free to put it in a public gist and link it in the issue: https://gist.github.com
-->
pip install sktime

Try importing anything that requires numba for example:

```
from sktime.distances import distance_alignment_path
dtw_path = distance_alignment_path(x, y, metric='dtw')
```

**Expected behavior**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->

**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context about the problem here.
-->
I dont know for a fact but id imagine you fix this by editing the pyproject.toml to specify 1.21 or less:

```
dependencies = [
    "deprecated>=1.2.13",
    "numba>=0.53",
    "numpy<=1.21.0",
    "pandas>=1.1.0,<1.5.0",
    "scikit-learn>=0.24.0,<1.2.0",
    "statsmodels>=0.12.1",
    "scipy<1.9.0",
]

```

**Versions**
<details>

<!--
Please run the following code snippet and paste the output here:
 
from sktime import show_versions; show_versions()
-->

</details>

<!-- Thanks for contributing! -->
